p: Methane mitigation from animal origin is a time demanding issue throughout the world. There are several possible targets and mitigation strategies ( Fig. 2) have been taken so far but still lack in sustainability. By 2050, the total CH 4 emission from ruminant animals is expected to increase significantly due to the increasing demand for milk and meat of animal origin for a hurriedly growing world population [ 74]. So, it is highly needed to mitigate CH 4 emission from the livestock industry. Here, we summarized important methane mitigation approaches in ruminant productions.
